tweets.text:
More heavy rain is forecast overnight. Don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks ‚Äì always avoid flood water. Check the flood risk in your area:  

https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/xHzsaCyYwu

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
It‚Äôs wet, wet, wet across the #Midlands today (Wednesday). Lots of surface water on roads. Please don‚Äôt drive through #flood water. 30cms is enough to float your car. Keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here 
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/fMneKq3b7w

Latest water level of the River Mersey at Northenden this morning - take care and stay safe. Let's hope  #StormChristoph relents a bit to allow the levels to go down.üôè

Follow the local guidance, advice and warnings from @EnvAgencyNW and @ManCityCouncil 

https://t.co/4OMQ9XjKhB https://t.co/lH0xrhhtNi

This @EnvAgency video provides you with some useful advice just in case you find yourself in a #flood situation #PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph You can also sign up for #flood alerts in your local area by clicking https://t.co/3j61SoqPlU #SafetyFirst #Yorkshire #NorthEast https://t.co/Yps90p2vqi

My go-to places for my first update of the day on #StormChristoph - the @metoffice to check latest rainfall and @EnvAgency #FloodWarnings and #river levels on https://t.co/cr6aAwXvpg. It‚Äôs vitally important to stay #floodaware https://t.co/WZuK7F7u7U https://t.co/7W2m9pUUGV

urls.title: Welcome to GOV.UK
urls.description: GOV.UK - The place to find government services and information - Simpler, clearer, faster

tweets.text: We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

tweets.text:
There are a number of flood warnings in place across England, with heavy rainfall expected in the next few days.

By knowing what to do in a #flood, you can reduce the impacts to your home, family and possessions.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY 

#StormCristoph https://t.co/FMPUiziILV

‚ö†Ô∏è The county is covered by several @metoffice rain warnings today including a Amber warning for certain areas.

A risk of some rivers flooding as a result of today‚Äôs rainfall.

tweets.text:
Two flood warnings have been issued for #Lancashire, meaning flooding is expected.

They're both for the River Ribble - at Walton-le-Dale and Samlesbury.

The @EnvAgencyNW is monitoring areas vulnerable to flooding across the county. https://t.co/MWLv2FASmx

‚ùó A flood warning has now been issued by the @EnvAgency for Ford Lane/Cheadle Wood following heavy rain (please see map below).
River levels are rising as a result of heavy rainfall associated with Storm Christoph. Flooding to properties in this area is expected
#stormchristoph https://t.co/6SzSGVe0uv

tweets.text:
üì¢ Flood warnings are now being issued for parts of Lancashire, Greater Manchester, Merseyside and Cheshire meaning that flooding is expected. 

For the latest warnings visit ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

#StormChristoph #Lancashire #GreaterManchester #Cheshire #Merseyside

Ok that‚Äôs me on as @EnvAgencyNW duty manager for #Cumbria and #Lancashire for the night shift.  Lots of #TeamEA out in the wet and dark doing vital work to protect communities from #StormChristoph while others are monitoring river levels  https://t.co/U7kgP2AgP5
@MarkBowersEA @EnvAgencyMids I suspect that map will look a little different

#DoYouKnow what to do in flood? 

#StormChristoph will bring widespread flood alerts and warnings across the North West over the next few days. 

Check your flood risk here ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/ZAITy41Ta6 https://t.co/GMyAQDBuRU

The @EnvAgency has issued flood warnings for River Roch at Littleborough and River Roch in Rochdale. Further details below. If you would like to report an incident in Rochdale affecting a property, please contact @RochdaleCouncil Floodline on 0300 303 0420 @gmpolice @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/riNEJYA2LW

Early notification from @EnvAgency that #groundwater levels in the Chalk #aquifer of the River Ver catchment are high and still rising. Currently, considered a low risk of groundwater flooding https://t.co/7jzkLj2yE0

With heavy rain forecast, our officers have stepped up patrols, clearing screens and inspecting flood defences. 
Get the latest flood info & sign up to receive flood warnings here: 
https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/tWxRI5w92Y

River levels are expected to rise in our area this week.

üì© Sign up to receive flood warnings https://t.co/I4DMBiMe34

üîé Search for warnings and alerts near you https://t.co/Jc9hMf6wuH

üö® What to do in an emergency https://t.co/lIwXZCHi7u

Follow @EnvAgencySE for updates

tweets.text: My duty patch tonight covers #Shropshire, #Herefordshire, #Worcestershire & #Gloucestershire. We‚Äôve currently got 3 #floodalerts out. I‚Äôll post the same picture tomorrow at a similar time. Once the rain has fallen this will change quickly from the early hours. #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/XvmmzVWfK8

Feeling immensely proud of the @EnvAgencyNW operations team who have been out all night making a real difference and stopping people homes from flooding - sadly we can‚Äôt be everywhere though. https://t.co/gVEmoq8aSC

Still a few places for #NFM webinar 'what we‚Äôve learned from the Defra ¬£15 million NFM pilot programme' this Thursday 21st 12:30-13:30. Jon Hollis from @EnvAgency will explain how the EA plan to take on the Defra research findings.  Book your free place: https://t.co/sXVJz14YN1 https://t.co/VicN3HZeM5

urls.title: What we‚Äôve learned from the Defra ¬£15 million NFM pilot programme
urls.description: Part of webinar series: NERC Evaluating NFM Programme - to allow NFM researchers and practitioners to share knowledge and experience

tweets.text: @RobStoneman @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Not sure it can be fully blaimed on upland management.  Around here gullies are never cleared so they are unable to catch silt hence silting of watercourses and the drainage cannot operate as designed.

urls.title: 'Driving conditions could be difficult' warn Devon County Council for those who have to venture out
urls.description: There's a Met Office yellow weather warning for rain in force until around...

tweets.text:
#FloodWarnings are in force across England as a result of #StormChristoph. #TeamEA have been working 24/7 to keep our communities safe. Stay safe at home and find out what to do in a flood: https://t.co/X4IQl3fUIh  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/EkLRcEMncE

Ironbridge temporary flood barriers going up tomorrow. 

Due to heavy rain across Shropshire & upper Severn, barriers are needed to protect communities from #flooding. 

Wharfage resurfacing prep work had started, however this work is postponed while the barriers are needed. https://t.co/sY7ue1o4Lf

@metoffice #StormCristoph could mean parts of the Midlands get two months' worth of rain in just two days. Flood barriers are being deployed in Ironbridge #HeartNews (üì∏ @EnvAgencyMids) https://t.co/2Vv1dn4w08

With persistent heavy rainfall across the #Midlands today make sure you stay #floodaware 

‚ö†Ô∏èCheck your #flood risk: https://t.co/8HEpx2nkWv
‚ö†Ô∏èSign up for flood alerts:
https://t.co/4G9UCfW5wr 
‚ö†Ô∏è Call Floodline: 0345 988 1188

REMEMBER:‚ö†Ô∏è Never walk or drive through flood water! https://t.co/JoGOGP6DzU

Making a journey this week? Please do not drive through #flood water. Check your route before you travel: https://t.co/tumDuoEmi2 Remember just one egg cup of water is enough to wreck your engine. #StormChristoph  #PrepareActSurvive #SafetyFirst https://t.co/di6rCwoPtZ

tweets.text: @Calderdale Do we know if the reservoirs were drained in advance ?@EnvAgencyYNE
30cm of flowing water is enough to move your car. Never drive through flood water. What to do during a flood: https://t.co/yOnoPDvQSt #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/YVW0JKGIql

tweets.text: Be prepared for flooding. Make sure you sign up for free flood warnings from https://t.co/nvMF75JN9W #prepareactsurvive https://t.co/oltghErLlB

I am always the first to criticise the @EnvAgency but they have been fantastic the last 48hrs. Good comms and on banks sheeting and hopefully sandbagging! Thank You! @NRobinsonEA @EnvAgencyMids @simonfisherNFU

urls.title: Storm Christoph presents significant flood risk | Association of Drainage Authorities
urls.description: The Met Office are expecting persistent heavy rainfall (between 100mm and 200mm) across a large swathe of Britain over the coming days. The Environment Agency anticipate flooding from Tuesday 19 January to parts of northern England and then northern, central and eastern England on Wednesday 20 and Thursday 21 January, with minor flood impacts possible [‚Ä¶]

tweets.text: @rattycastle @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencyNW teams are present in #Carlisle / Warwick Road - new defenses in Melbourne Park are operational  giving Storm Desmond level protection.  That area currently at flood alert and not expected to change overnight. But teams monitoring and will keep people informed

*Flooding update*

Flood Alerts have been re-issued for the Lower Don, River Idle, River Went and River Dearne.

This covers the following areas: Bawtry, Bentley, Conisborough, Clay Lane, Fishlake, Intake, Mexborough, Scawthorpe, Tickhill and Wadworth. https://t.co/gXOnQ7JOWP
üåßÔ∏è Sandbag barriers being built and floodgates shut in York as the city prepares for serious flooding along the River Ouse https://t.co/pHcEVOxj8c

Still a few places for #NFM webinar 'what we‚Äôve learned from the Defra ¬£15 million NFM pilot programme' this Thursday 21st 12:30-13:30. Jon Hollis from @EnvAgency will explain how the EA plan to take on the Defra research findings.  Book your free place: https://t.co/sXVJz14YN1 https://t.co/VicN3HZeM5

There are #FloodWarnings in place as #StormChristoph brings heavy rain across England.  

Know what to do in a flood and check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7Fwblnq  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/MaE7ptFod2

A dairy farmer, stuck up to their axles in mud whilst out spreading slurry during #StormChristoph on bare #maize stubble adjacent to a ditch.

There's been a big increase in illegal farm activities since the Covid started. Penalties should follow suit. https://t.co/TzA4AuUA0G

UPDATE: Siren activated in #Walsden by @EnvAgencyYNE where river levels at highest. @Calderdale @WestYorksPolice staff on site supporting local residents. All flood plans to be activated. #StormChristoph
